document.docAuthor: Asenjo, Angélico, Irmler, Ulrich, Klimaszewski, Jan, Chandler, Donald S., Fierros-López, Hugo Eduardo & Vieira, Juliana S.
document.masterDocTitle: Staphylinidae (Insecta: Coleoptera) in Latin America: synopsis, annotated catalog, diversity and distribution

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Staphylinidae (Insecta: Coleoptera) in Latin America: synopsis, annotated catalog, diversity and distribution

bibRefCitation.author: Comellini, A.
bibRefCitation.refString: Comellini, A. (1985) Notes sur les Pselaphides neotropicaux (Coleoptera). 5 - La tribu des Pyxidicerini. Revue Suisse de Zoologie, 92 (3), 707 - 759. https: // doi. org / 10.5962 / bhl. part. 81908

subSubSection.paragraph: 13 species are known from and are restricted to Central and South America.
Characters/Description: Comellini 1985: 710 (characters in key); Coulon 1989: 188 (characters in key), 189 (characters); Chandler 2002: 54 (characters in key).
Central America: Mexico , Costa Rica , Panama .

bibRefCitation.author: Comellini, A.
bibRefCitation.refString: Comellini, A. (1985) Notes sur les Pselaphides neotropicaux (Coleoptera). 5 - La tribu des Pyxidicerini. Revue Suisse de Zoologie, 92 (3), 707 - 759. https: // doi. org / 10.5962 / bhl. part. 81908

subSubSection.paragraph: 1 species is included in this genus from Central America.
Characters/Description: Comellini 1985: 710 (characters in key); Coulon 1989: 85 (characters in key), 150 (characters); Chandler 2002: 54 (characters in key).

bibRefCitation.author: Reitter, E.
bibRefCitation.refString: Reitter, E. (1882 b) Versuch einer systematischen Eintheilung der Clavigeriden und Pselaphiden. Verhandlungen des Naturforschenden Vereines in Brunn, 20, 177 - 211. [Note: nominal year of publication 1881]

subSubSection.paragraph: 31 species are included in this genus from Latin America.

Key: O. Park 1944: 251 (Mexican species); O. Park 1945a: 278 (species of the genus); O. Park 1952a: 7 (species of the genus); Becker & Sanderson 1953a: 406 (species of Honduras ); O.
Park et al. 1976: 5
(species of the West Indies); Newton & Peck 2006: 133 (species of Galapagos Isl.).
West Indies: Bahamas , Cuba , US Virgin Isl., Grenada , Trinidad-Tobago.
Central America: Mexico , Guatemala , Honduras , Costa Rica , Panama .
South America: Suriname , French Guiana , Galapagos Isl., Peru , Brazil , Paraguay , Argentina .

subSubSection.paragraph: 2 species are included in this genus from Central and South America.
Characters/Description: Comellini 1985: 710 (characters in key), 742 (characters); Coulon 1989: 188 (characters in key), 191 (characters); Chandler 2001: 75 (characters in key), 76 (characters).

subSubSection.paragraph: 10 species are known from and are restricted to Central and South America.
Characters/Description: Comellini 1985: 710 (characters in key); Coulon 1989: 234 (characters in key), 236 (characters).
South America: Colombia , Venezuela , French Guiana , Brazil .
